intro: Leucobarleria nivea, commonly known as the white barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, oblong seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for gardens and landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate foliage and prolonged blooming period.
